title: "Python Matrices"
tutorial:
"

In python, a matrix is defined simply as a list of lists. To make a matrix in python, you have to be familiar with lists. This was covered in the previous sections of this course. If you don't remember/ or want to reapeat this exercise, you can navigate back to it by using the menu you find at the top of this page.

To recap; this is how we created a list in python: 


# Creating a list in python
list1 = [3, 8, 9, 1]

This list represents one line in a simple 3 column matrix. Now, you might already understand how we would go about creating the rows. If you guessed a list of list, you'd be correct. This is how we define a list of lists in python: 


# Creating a list of lists in Python
list1 = [3, 8, 9, 1]
list2 = [8, 3, 6, 0]
list3 = [0, 8, 3, 1]

matrix = [list1, list2, list3]

And that's all that there is to it! This is how we create a simple matrix in python. And now, we want you to make your very own matrix in the exercise below.

"
exdesc:
"

In this exercise we want you to create a simple matrix in python.

  • Make four different lists, and store them in the variables list1 through list4. Each list should have a total of 4 values. The values can be any real number.
  • Make a list of lists, and store that in the matrix variable
    Hint
"
